comments:
1) Select Menu - [Window]-[Show view]-[Other]
2) Select [SWT Examples]-[OLE Web Browser (Win32)]
3) load the following HTML


<OBJECT classid="clsid:8AD9C840-044E-11D1-B3E9-00805F499D93" 
WIDTH = 500 HEIGHT = 500  
codebase="http://java.sun.com/products/plugin/1.1.2/jinstall-112-
win32.cab#Version=1,1,2,0">

The HTML is using java plugin provided SUN microsystems, 
and it is popular for Applet user (see the following web site).
http://java.sun.com/j2se/1.4/docs/guide/plugin/developer_guide/using_tags.html

If this happens only on example, I don't think this is critical.
But other implementations for web browser using MSIE do same behavior.
So I think base (OLE support?) has problem or can have work-around.

I don't understand how this PR can be marked "major", given that the only 
evidence of the problem is that a particular example is failing.

I also am having trouble understanding the sentence "But other implementations 
for web browser using MSIE do same behavior.". Are you saying that, other Java 
applications which embed the IE ActiveX control do not crash when loading this 
example?

I said other implementations of embeded IE based on SWT OLE also 
crash with the example HTML.

Actually, IBM WSAD 4.0 which is based on R1.0 crashes when 
the example html is opened by "Open with..."->"Web Browser".
It must be same situation for R2.0-based "Web Browser".

The workbench does not hang for me.

I created a file with the html provided and tried to open it with IE.
IE just sits there with the status bar showing "APPLET tag missing CODE 
parameter."  In IE, the cursor stays busy but you are able to select toolbar 
items such as forward and back.  

The same thing happens with the SWT Example Web Browser.
In addition, the following is displayed in the console:

APPLET tag missing CODE parameter.
java.io.FileNotFoundException: C:\Program Files\Java Plug-in 1.1\classes
	at java.io.FileInputStream.<init>(FileInputStream.java:56)
	at java.lang.ClassLoader.getSystemResourceAsStream(ClassLoader.java:364)
	at sun.applet.AppletClassLoader.getResourceAsStream
(AppletClassLoader.java:597)
	at sun.applet.AppletPanel.createApplet(AppletPanel.java:466)
	at sun.applet.AppletPanel.runLoader(AppletPanel.java:395)
	at sun.applet.AppletPanel.run(Compiled Code)
	at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:466)

If I do not have the Java Plugin installed for IE.  I get a dialog prompting me 
to install the plugin.  This happens in both IE and SWT Example Web Browser.  
Once plugin is installed you get the same behaviour described in my previous 
post.  Install dialog is not modal and does not "hang" Eclipse.
Works for me in Eclipse 2.0.1 on Windows 2000 and Windows XP.

Created an attachment (id=1941)
File to hang workbench up

Sorry to late for my reply.
I checked again with the latest workbench and still hang up.
I attached a html file. Please try it.
I tried both on windows2000 and XP.

Created an attachment (id=1942)
One more file to check
This doesn't happen on PC which has Java Plugin.

I ran your latest attachment in Internet Explorer.  IE hangs and  the status 
line says "exception: null". If IE hangs, I would be surprised if an ActiveX 
container for IE would behave any differently.  The problem appears to be in 
your applet.
